meanings.definition: To form an opinion or give a guess.
meanings.sent1: I will gesse the answer to the riddle.
meanings.sent2: Can you gesse how many jellybeans are in the jar?
meanings.sent3: He likes to gesse the ending of movies before they finish.
meanings.sent4: Her intuition allowed her to gesse the correct path to take.
meanings.sent5: The detective had to gesse the culprit's identity based on the evidence.

meanings.sent1: She will gesse the time it takes to finish the race.
meanings.sent2: It is hard to gesse how much the repair will cost.
meanings.sent3: The children like to gesse how many candies are in the jar.
meanings.sent4: The scientist could only gesse at the outcome of the experiment.
meanings.sent5: The weather forecasters gessed that it would rain tomorrow.

meanings.sent1: I gesse he will arrive late to the meeting.
meanings.sent2: Do you gesse what the surprise could be?
meanings.sent3: She likes to gesse what her friends are planning.
meanings.sent4: The teacher could only gesse why the student was absent.
meanings.sent5: He gessed that the store would be closed by the time he got there.
